'''Benson Kwan''' is a [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Internship|intern]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


<!--Replace this line, including the arrow brackets, with the article body and details. If no information can go under the sections then go ahead and remove them.-->


Benson "Blue" Kwan is sharp-witted, impatient and brilliant. He is generous by nature but competitive to a fault, naturally gifted, and used to winning at everything. A family crisis interfered with his career plans and now he's got a lot to prove.



[[Jules Millin]]
In the locker room after recording the sex ed videos, Benson and Jules shared a quiet and intense look. They then headed to an on call room, where Benson kissed Jules. After she assured Benson that it would not happen again, that there were no feelings involved and that she didn't like him, the two had sex.<ref>[[Let's Talk About Sex]], x</ref>




<!--Replace this line, including the arrow brackets, with the article body and details. If no information can go under the sections then go ahead and remove them.-->


He is a [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Internship|intern]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


*In initial reports surrounding the character, he was named ''Daniel'' Kwan.
*He was valedictorian, all state track & field, and national chess champion in high school.<ref>[[Thunderstruck]], x</ref>

'''Cara Martinez''' is the daughter of [[Sarah Martinez]].


Cara's mother, Sarah, was in the hospital waiting for at triple organ transplant. After a tour bus was thrown off a cliff during a tornado, Sarah and her family were told they had a donor for her, for all three organs. Before Sarah was taken into surgery, she said that if she died instead of being buried or cremated, she wanted her family to turn her into a tree, so she could fight climate change and helped the world instead of contributing to pollution.

Sarah's transplant went forward and was successful. When she woke up after the surgery, she asked to see her family, but was told she'd need to wait a few days to heal more before that would be possible. She also asked to thank her donor's family.



She is close with her parents and brother.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Martinez, Cara}}

'''Chase Sams''' is a college student who thought he had food poisoning and ended up in the ICU.


Chase and his college roommate came into the ER with what they believed was food poisoning they got from eating leftover fried rice. They both vomited several times while they waited to be seen by a doctor. [[Simone Griffith]] and [[Jules Millin]] examined them and then planned to start IV fluids to combat the dehydration from the vomiting, but Chase started to struggle to breathe. They examined him further and found a rash on his abdomen. They paged Richard and Meredith, who examined him even more closely and found that the rash was also on his arms and legs. Meredith ordered a chest x-ray and then said to admit him to the ICU on high-flow oxygen. In the ICU, he became completely unresponsive and the rash continued to spread. Meredith intubated him and put him on pressers, which stabilized him, but he started bleeding around his central line. At this point, Meredith challenged the interns to work together to diagnose him. Meanwhile, Link examined his leg and found that the tissue was dead, so it would have to be amputated below his knee. While was in surgery, Simone realized he had meningococcus.  He had some unexpected bleeding in surgery, but they were able to get it under control and his friend was told he'd be okay.



His parents are divorced. His mother got on a flight to Seattle when she learned he was in the hospital.


He is close friends with his roommate. His roommate was an only child with social anxiety who didn't want a roommate, but Chase helped him come out of his shell and meet new people.


*He plays Barn Finders.
*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.
*He's from Massachusetts.
*He's a history major, loves sports documentaries, and hates coffee.
*He once had syphilis.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Sams, Chase}}

'''Dr. Shagrin''' is the family physician of Liam Collins, who came to the hospital after a tour bus crash.


When one of his patients, Liam Collins, was in an accident and had been mixed up with another patient, Dr. Shagrin was called the hospital to look over his test results. When he arrived, [[Simone Griffith]] took him to the viewing room, where [[Amelia Shepherd|Amelia]] went over all his results. At the end, Dr. Shagrin told [[Jane Collins]], Liam's mom, that he agreed with the doctors' assessment that he was brain dead.


He is a family medicine practitioner.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Shagrin, Dr.}}

'''Harold Peters''' is a patient who shoved his wife's phone into his rectum.


Harold came into the ER with abdominal pain. He told the doctors he thought he knew what it was, but before he could tell them, his wife, [[Sharon Peters|Sharon]], came in. Owen palpated his abdomen and said he wanted to do an ultrasound because it was distended. The ultrasound showed nothing abnormal, so Owen ordered a CT. Before they could get that, Sharon use Harold's phone to call her own after learning it was at the hospital. It rang and Harold was forced to admit that he'd shoved it into his rectum. He said he'd done it because she was always on her phone. They were able to extract the phone manually, but he later went into cardiac arrest and had to be resuscitated in the ER.



He is married to [[Sharon Peters]].


He and his wife have children.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Peters, Harold}}

'''Jane Collins''' is the mother of Liam Collins, who was killed in a tour bus crash.


Jane came to the hospital when her son, Liam, was in a tour bus that was swept off a cliff by a tornado. After some tests were performed, Liam was taken to have his organs harvested for transplant. However, due to an error, Jane was not informed and almost missed the chance to say goodbye to him. When his error was discovered, she insisted that Amelia re-run all the confirmatory tests and brought in their family doctor, [[Dr. Shagrin]], to consult on the case. When the tests confirmed the same diagnosis and Dr. Shagrin agreed, Simone told Jane that her son was brain dead. Wanting to make sure Jane agreed to proceed with the donation of Liam's organs, [[Benson Kwan|Blue Kwan]] told her how his brother died and his organs being donated helped Blue cope with that. She consented to the organ recovery.



Her son, Liam, died when the tour bus he was in was swept off a cliff by a tornado, causing a brain injury that led to brain death.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Collins, Jane}}

'''Joyce Ward''' is [[Simone Griffith|Simone Griffith's]] grandmother.



Joyce sent Simone off to work one morning with a bag that she said contained her lunch, Simone's favorite. Simone opened the bag to find the remote and other household items. Despite this, she told Joyce it was her favorite and left with the bag. ''("[[Wasn't Expecting That]]")''


Joyce came to the hospital, believing she was visiting her daughter, who was in labor. [[Lucas Adams]] looked up her daughter and found she was both dead and Simone's mother. He paged Simone to the ER so she could take care of her grandmother. Simone tried to orient Joyce to reality, but this agitated Joyce, so Meredith stepped in to calm her down. Once she was calm, Lucas took her to a lounge to play cards with her. Simone later took over and pretended to be her mother, whom Joyce thought she was. ''("[[Let's Talk About Sex]]")''




She is [[Simone Griffith|Simone Griffith's]] grandmother.

'''Jules Millin''' is a [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Internship|intern]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



Jules and her brother grew up with their drug-addicted parents. 


Jules was interviewed by a selection committee at Grey Sloan and selected to start out her internship there as part of the hospital's new residency program that was designed to give an opportunity to "diamonds in the rough", doctors who did not match or were fired elsewhere.

The Saturday night before starting out as an intern at Grey Sloan, Jules met [[Atticus Lincoln]] at a bar after matching on a dating app and they spent the night together. On her first day, Jules ran into him almost immediately after arriving. He apologized for not having called her like he had told her he would and she reminded him she worked there now. She then tagged along with [[Mika Yasuda]], whom she recognized from the introduction, so they could find scrubs together. As they walked Jules, shared that she had already slept with an attending, a fact that Mika shared with the rest of the interns much to Jules's dismay. After changing into the scrubs, the group of interns were welcomed by interim Chief of Surgery [[Meredith Grey]] in the newly equipped OR. She stressed that their life stories and their fight was had gotten them into the program rather than their grades. 

Afterward, Amelia took the interns to the ICU and informed them about a bus driving off a cliff during the tornado, rendering fourteen patients potentially brain dead and thus organ donors. She assigned each intern a patient to examine and confirm brain death. Jules's patient was among the brain dead patients so she had to inform the family. Her patient turned out to be a match for one of Maggie's patient awaiting a heart transplant. Having read Maggie's article about racial disparities in outcomes after bypass surgery, Jules was a fan of hers and eager to inform Maggie. In need of some good news, she asked Maggie if she could be part of the procedure, which Maggie allowed. Together, they informed Howard and his emotional husband about the availability of a donor heart. However, the joy was cut short during the organ retrieval when Maggie deemed that there were too many hematomas on the donor heart for it to be used. She allowed Jules to close the incision under chief resident Levi's supervision. He cautioned her to always be polite to [[BokHee]].

Later, she found Link waiting for her outside the intern locker room and he inquired about her first shift. She told him it seemed endless and was both exhilarating and depressing. He then revealed he brought HR paperwork about their relationship for her to sign so things wouldn't get messy. She clarified they did not have a relationship and that she just considered him a friend. He claimed he didn't want a relationship either but she pointed out he had been waiting for her outside the locker room like a stalker. The interns then met up in [[The Tunnels|the tunnels]] and reflected on their first shift. They touched upon the fact that each of them was a loser or reject in some way for them to have ended up at Grey Sloan though no one shared any specific details. They were soon paged and rushed back off to work.<ref>[[Everything Has Changed]], x</ref>


Jules was raised by drug addled artist/hippies and somehow emerged as the only real grown-up in the family. Because she always had to take care of herself and her parents, she can be a little bossy \u but her heart is always in the right place. She's not afraid to break the rules to save a life, and sometimes it gets her in trouble. She is empathetic and in touch with her emotions.



[[Atticus Lincoln]]
Link and Jules hooked up after meeting on a dating app. On Jules' first day at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital|Grey Sloan Memorial]], she bumped into Link and recognized him from the night they spent together. Link apologized for not calling like he had said he would, but she assured him that it was okay and explained that she wasn't there for him and that she worked at the hospital. Later that day, Link met Jules outside the intern locker room and explained that he brought her some HR paperwork for her to sign, stating that their relationship predated her employment at Grey Sloan Memorial. Jules got confused and pointed out that they didn't have a relationship.<ref>[[Everything Has Changed]], x</ref>

When Jules got to scrub in on a below the knee amputation, she saw that Link had written messages on the patient's legs to indicate which leg to cut off. She mistook this for flirting and asked him if he was flirting with her over a sick patient's leg. Link quickly explained that he was being a supportive teacher and didn't want her to cut off the wrong leg.<ref>[[Wasn't Expecting That]], x</ref>

When Jules needed help recording sexual education videos, she found Link in the pit and asked him if he could help her, but he told her it was inappropriate and said that he didn't want anyone to think that he was harassing her.<ref name=":">[[Let's Talk About Sex]], x</ref>

[[Benson Kwan]]
In the locker room after recording the sex ed videos, Benson and Jules shared a quiet and intense look. They then headed to an on call room, where Benson kissed Jules. After she assured Benson that it would not happen again, that there were no feelings involved and that she didn't like him, the two had sex. <ref name=":" />




<!--Replace this line, including the arrow brackets, with the article body and details. If no information can go under the sections then go ahead and remove them.-->

*She used to sell jewelry made by her mother at the farmer's market with her brother as a front for her father selling marijuana.<ref>[[Thunderstruck]], x</ref>

'''Marina Milton''' is a patient who was injured in a tour bus crash.


Marina was on a tour bus when a tornado blew it off a cliff. When she was rescued, she was among a handful of patients with brain injuries that could lead to brain death. They were all evaluated for brain death. While all the others showed no signs of brain activity, Marina was tracking with her eyes, showing she had some brain activity. She was watched carefully and her mother, [[Ms. Milton]], was told there was still hope. Because so many others had died in the crash, Ms. Milton refused to hope that Marina would live. Despite this, Marina later woke up.



Marina's mother came to the hospital to sit with her while she was unconscious.


*She was the sole survivor of those with brain injuries with the potential for brain death.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Milton, Marina}}

<!--Replace this line, including the arrow brackets, with the article body and details. If no information can go under the sections then go ahead and remove them.-->


She is a middle child with eight siblings. She is used to being overlooked and underestimated and uses it to her advantage. Mika is dealing with overwhelming student loans from med school, but she's scrappy and confident she can make it in the program and rise to the top.

|only appearance = [[Everything Has Changed]]
|seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]]

}}

'''Ms. Milton''' is the mother of [[Marina Milton]].


Ms. Milton's daughter, [[Marina Milton|Marina]], was on a tour bus when a tornado blew it off a cliff. When she was rescued, she was among a handful of patients with brain injuries that could lead to brain death. They were all evaluated for brain death. While all the others showed no signs of brain activity, Marina was tracking with her eyes, showing she had some brain activity. She was watched carefully and her mother was told there was still hope. Because so many others had died in the crash, Ms. Milton refused to hope that Marina would live. Despite this, Marina later woke up.



Her daughter, Marina, was in a tour brush crash and suffered a serious brain injury.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Milton, Ms.}}

'''Sarah Martinez''' is a patient who needed a triple organ transplant.


Sarah was in the hospital waiting for at triple organ transplant. After a tour bus was thrown off a cliff during a tornado, Sarah and her family were told they had a donor for her, for all three organs. Before Sarah was taken into surgery, she said that if she died instead of being buried or cremated, she wanted her family to turn her into a tree, so she could fight climate change and helped the world instead of contributing to pollution.

Sarah's transplant went forward and was successful. When she woke up after the surgery, she asked to see her family, but was told she'd need to wait a few days to heal more before that would be possible. She also asked to thank her donor's family.



She is married to [[Davis Martinez]].


Her two children came to the hospital when he had her transplants. When they heard she was getting her organs, they were so excited, they called for a group hug between all of them and Sarah's doctors. She is about to become a grandmother.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Martinez, Sarah}}

'''Sharon Peters''' is the wife of [[Harold Peters]].


Sharon's husband, Harold, came into the ER with abdominal pain. He told the doctors he thought he knew what it was, but before he could tell them, Sharon came in. Owen palpated his abdomen and said he wanted to do an ultrasound because it was distended. The ultrasound showed nothing abnormal, so Owen ordered a CT. Before they could get that, Sharon use Harold's phone to call her own after learning it was at the hospital. It rang and Harold was forced to admit that he'd shoved it into his rectum. He said he'd done it because she was always on her phone. They were able to extract the phone manually, but he later went into cardiac arrest and had to be resuscitated in the ER.



She is married to [[Harold Peters]].


She and Harold have at least two children.

'''Simone Griffith''' is a [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Internship|intern]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


<!--Replace this line, including the arrow brackets, with the article body and details. If no information can go under the sections then go ahead and remove them.-->


Simone is a funny, whip smart, high achiever with a complicated family dynamic. She grew up in Seattle, but never wanted to work at Grey Sloan because of a painful personal history with the hospital.




Her mother died at Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital while giving birth to Simone.<ref>[[Everything Has Changed]], x</ref>



<!--Replace this line, including the arrow brackets, with the article body and details. If no information can go under the sections then go ahead and remove them.-->
